item.title: Server testing
item.description: Nothing thrilling at all with this one, but if it’s visible after 5:40pm on 23/11/25 NZST then I have successfully implemented a much more automated workflow. This means I can write as much as I want, and literally push one button which runs a .bat script that pushes it to Github after prompting me only for a commit message. My server then has another script which hopefully runs every 20 minutes past the hour (3 times an hour, at :00, :20, and :40) if I wrote it correctly that should delete the old directory and automagically pull the updated copy from Github.

item.title: Two Hours That Weren't Nearly Enough
item.description:
We found what I called a very niche spot in the botanic gardens today, and time forgot how to move properly.

He leaned into me first, or maybe I leaned into him, it’s hard to say where one gesture ended and another began. Suddenly we were cuddled on a bench, the world shrinking to the size of us.

It was perfect in a way that stays with you. The kind of thing that makes you understand what people mean when they talk about missing someone who hasnâ€™t left. I already want more of how easy it felt, how right. The conversations didnâ€™t need forcing, and the silences didnâ€™t need filling.

A running list of the most useful stuff Iâ€™ve found while trying to get prints to not look like cursed spaghetti. Whether you’re calibrating, troubleshooting, or just figuring out what the hell retraction actually does â€” these are worth checking out.
